text:
<%@ page language="java" contentType="text/xml"%>
<jsp:include page="sample.xml"/>

the above jsp causes an IllegalStateException the following is just fine:
(the files are identical)

<%@ page language="java" contentType="text/xml"%>
<jsp:include page="sample.html"/>

My guess is that someone is messing about with the outputStream in order to get
the XML encoding sorted... still surely the contentType drives this not the file
extension?
creator: simon.beaumont@biowisdom.com
markt@apache.org
text:
jsp:include is into out, a JspWriter. The DefaultServlet uses a OutputStream by
default and falls back to a Writer (for text documents only) if an ISE is
encountered retrieving the OutputStream (as it will be for jsp:include).

The DefaultServlet was not treating xml files as text documents and hence wasn't
falling back to a writer.

This has been fixed and will be included in 5.5.21 onwards.
